pages.text: Gigantoproductus is a large brachiopod from the Carboniferous period. It is the largest brachiopod known, reaching up to 30 cm in length. They inhabited shallow seas and likely became so large as a result of the rise in oxygen levels, which allowed invertebrates to become larger than usual.
